newsitem.title: CHINA: HK stocks seen drifting lower in sideways trade.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks seen drifting lower in sideways trade.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are expected to open softer in sideways trading on a lack of fresh incentives as the market continues to be overhung by uncertainty in the local property market, brokers said on Tuesday.
"The market is likely to turn weaker as buying interest on property stocks is muted by a lack of fresh news," Peter So, deputy head of research at Schroder Securities.
The Hang Seng Index closed 35.61 points higher on Monday at 14,858.58. Later the Hang Seng London Reference Index eased 27.98 points to 14,830.60.
But banks should continue to go firmer, So said.
